pgTitle: List of works by Thomas Taylor

rows.text: Rebuilt the south side in Gothic Revival style, including a large window in the transept. The church was replaced by the current church in 1837–41.{{sfn|Webster|2012|pp=105–106}}
Later used as accommodation for a residential college.
In Neoclassical style, incorporating a portico with four Corinthian columns.{{sfn|Webster|2012|pp=105–107}}
Taylor's first church, large with a west tower, aisles, a clerestory, and chancel relatively large for the time.{{sfn|Webster|2012|pp=109–115}}
A church with a smaller chancel than Liversedge. It was demolished in 1878.{{sfn|Webster|2012|p=116}}

Colne, Lancashire
{{coord|53.8573|-2.1703|name=Church of St Bartholomew, Colne}}
Church of St Mary the Blessed Virgin
File:The Parish Church of St Mary's Luddenden - geograph.org.uk - 987114.jpg
A new church replacing an earlier church on the site.{{sfn|Webster|2012|p=116}}
Church of St Anne in the Grove
File:St Anne in the Grove Church, Church Lane, Southowram - geograph.org.uk - 404261.jpg
A new church, the chancel being added later.{{sfn|Webster|2012|p=116}}

Huddersfield, West Yorkshire
{{coord|53.6499|-1.7929|name=Holy Trinity Church, Huddersfield}}
A new church with a prominent west tower.{{sfn|Webster|2012|p=116–117}}
File:Holy Trinity Parish Church, Littleborough - geograph.org.uk - 1272010.jpg

Rebuilt the church, replacing a chapel of ease dating from 1471. Taylor added a new gallery in 1822–23. The chancel was added in 1889 by J. S. Crowther.{{sfn|Webster|2012|pp=116, 123}}{{sfn|Hartwell|Hyde|Pevsner|2004|p=249}}

Ossett, West Yorkshire
{{coord|53.6860|-1.5828|name=Holy Trinity Church, Ossett}}
Extended a church that had been built in 1806. This church was demolished and replaced in 1862–65.{{sfn|Webster|2012|p=123}}
Added a new gallery to a chapel dating from 1707. The chapel was replaced in 1866.{{sfn|Webster|2012|p=123}}

Pudsey, West Yorkshire
{{coord|53.7934|-1.6668|name=St Lawrence's Church, Pudsey}}
A Commissioners' church built to replace a former chapel of ease.{{sfn|Webster|2012|pp=117–119}}{{sfn|Port|2006|p=329}}
A Commissioners' church with a tower. Bombed in 1940; demolished other than the tower 1950.{{sfn|Webster|2012|p=119}}{{sfn|Port|2006|p=329}}{{sfn|Harman|Minnis|2004|p=14}}
A Commissioners' church with a tower. Demolished in 1952.{{sfn|Webster|2012|p=119}}{{sfn|Port|2006|p=329}}
File:Christ Church, Woodhouse Hill, Fartown, Huddersfield - geograph.org.uk - 860674.jpg
A new church with transepts and a west tower surmounted by a broach spire.{{sfn|Webster|2012|pp=121–122}}
A Commissioners' church, altered in 1894, damaged by fire in 1916, and restored the following year.{{sfn|Port|2006|p=329}}
A Commissioners' church with a tower. Demolished in the late 1970s.{{sfn|Port|2006|p=329}}

Dewsbury, West Yorkshire
{{coord|53.6920|-1.6508|name=St John's Church, Dewsbury}}
File:St John's Church, Dewsbury Moor - geograph.org.uk - 377802.jpg
A Commissioners' church with a west tower, crenellated parapets and lancet windows.{{sfn|Webster|2012|p=119}}{{sfn|Port|2006|p=329}}
Built as a girls' national school; later a clubroom.

Birstall, West Yorkshire
{{coord|53.7316|-1.6702|name=St Peter's Church, Birstall}}
Alterations to a medieval church, which was demolished and replaced in 1863–70.{{sfn|Webster|2012|p=123}}
A small church with a west tower surmounted by a broach spire with lucarnes. The churchyard walls, gates and gatepiers are listed separately, also at Grade II.{{sfn|Webster|2012|p=122}}
A Commissioners' church with transepts, tower and spire. Demolished in 1971.{{sfn|Webster|2012|p=122}}{{sfn|Port|2006|p=329}}

Ripon, North Yorkshire
{{coord|54.1380|-1.5285|name=Holy Trinity Church, Ripon}}
A new church, with a cruciform plan and a tall steeple. Alterations were made later in the 19th century.{{sfn|Webster|2012|p=122}}
For Stephen Nicholson of Roundhay Park.
